Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lactolisterin BU (natural AMPs; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXI)
Sequence Information.Source: Lactococcus lactissubsp. lactis bv. diacetylactis BGBU1-4

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 63% similarity toMutacin BHT-B.  Molecular formula:  C243H365N64O55S2; Mol Wt 5135.055; GRAVY= -0.15; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:  -3.65  kcal/mol. leaderless.Activity: Active against L. lactis subsp. lactis BGMN1-596, L. lactis subsp. lactis BGBU1-4, L. lactis subsp. lactis BGBU1-4/2, L. lactis subsp. cremoris MG7284/pBU6, L. casei BGHN14, L. monocytogenes ATCC 19111, S. aureus ATCC 25923, E. faecalis ATCC 29212, E. faecalis BGZLS10-27,  S. pyogenes,  S. pnumoniae (MIC 0.67-1.34 uM),  B. subtilis subsp. subtilis ATCC23857, and B. cereus ATCC 11778 (MIC 5.3 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Lozo J, Mirkovic N, O'Connor PM, Malesevic M, Miljkovic M, Polovic N, Jovcic B, Cotter PD, Kojic M.2017
Literature Information.Reference: Appl Environ Microbiol. 2017 Aug 25. pii: AEM.01519-17. doi: 10.1128/AEM.01519-17.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Lactolisterin BU, a novel Class II broad spectrum bacteriocin from Lactococcus lactis subsp. lactis bv. diacetylactis BGBU1-4.
